alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 3:28PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 12 inches in the valleys and 1 to 2 feet in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph in the mountains Tuesday. Valley wind gusts 20 to 30 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Dobson Pass, Mullan, Clark Fork, Sandpoint, Lookout Pass, Priest River, Fourth Of July Pass, Fernwood, Kellogg, Wallace, Eastport, St. Maries, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Athol, Bonners Ferry, Osburn, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From 4 PM Monday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1.
